importantDates.descriptionOfWhyDateIsRelevant: The date marks the update of the Sunday review article on NFL Week 7, highlighting current developments in the 2025 NFL season.

importantTimeframes.descriptionOfWhyTimeFrameIsRelevant: The time frame of Week 7 of the 2025 NFL season reflects the ongoing theme of dramatic comebacks, record-breaking performances, and roster changes, contributing to heightened public interest in team dynamics and player performance.

keyTakeAways: Multiple teams in the NFL experienced dramatic comebacks in the final minutes of games, with the Denver Broncos overcoming a 19-point deficit against the New York Giants.
Drake Maye of the New England Patriots set a franchise record with a 91.3 completion percentage, surpassing Tom Brady’s previous mark of 88.5%, marking a pivotal moment for the team's future.

Second-year quarterback Bo Nix led a historic fourth-quarter comeback in Denver, becoming the first team in NFL history to overcome a 19-point deficit after leading by 18 points in the first three quarters.
The Green Bay Packers forced a turnover on downs in the final minutes to defeat the Arizona Cardinals, showcasing defensive dominance.
Quarterbacks Justin Fields and Tua Tagovailoa were benched during games due to poor performances, highlighting instability in offensive leadership and increasing pressure on coaching staffs.

The Miami Dolphins and New York Jets both suffered significant losses, with the Dolphins losing to the Browns and the Jets to the Panthers, leading to quarterback changes and intensified scrutiny on team performance.
The 2025 NFL season has seen an unprecedented number of lead changes in the final two minutes of regulation, with 26 such changes through Week 7—more than in any previous season in NFL history.

namedEntities.name: Denver Broncos
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The Denver Broncos made a historic comeback against the New York Giants, overturning a 19-point deficit in the fourth quarter, becoming the first team in NFL history to overcome such a deficit after leading by 18 points in the first three quarters.

namedEntities.name: New York Giants
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The New York Giants were defeated by the Denver Broncos in a dramatic comeback, with the Broncos overcoming a 19-point deficit in the final minutes, marking one of the most dramatic comebacks in NFL history.

namedEntities.name: Green Bay Packers
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The Green Bay Packers forced a late turnover and scored two touchdowns in the final quarter to defeat the Arizona Cardinals, showcasing defensive strength and pivotal late-game execution.

namedEntities.name: Arizona Cardinals
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The Arizona Cardinals were defeated by the Green Bay Packers in the final minutes, with their backup quarterback Jacoby Brissett unable to execute a final drive due to defensive pressure.

namedEntities.name: New England Patriots
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The New England Patriots saw a breakout performance from quarterback Drake Maye, who broke Tom Brady’s franchise record for completion percentage in a single game.

namedEntities.name: Tennessee Titans
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The Tennessee Titans lost to the New England Patriots, where Drake Maye delivered a historic performance, including a 91.3 completion percentage and 200+ passing yards.

namedEntities.name: Miami Dolphins
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The Miami Dolphins suffered a humiliating 31-6 loss to the Cleveland Browns, leading to the immediate benching of quarterback Tua Tagovailoa in favor of rookie Quinn Ewers.

namedEntities.name: New York Jets
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The New York Jets were defeated 13-6 by the Carolina Panthers, resulting in the halftime benching of quarterback Justin Fields and the subsequent use of Tyrod Taylor.

namedEntities.name: Cleveland Browns
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The Cleveland Browns defeated the Miami Dolphins 31-6, contributing to the Dolphins’ early-season collapse and leading to the benching of Tua Tagovailoa.

namedEntities.name: Carolina Panthers
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The Carolina Panthers defeated the New York Jets 13-6, exposing offensive inconsistencies and prompting the Jets to bench their starting quarterback.

namedEntities.name: Drake Maye
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: Drake Maye, the No. 3 overall draft pick in 2024, broke Tom Brady’s Patriots franchise record for completion percentage with a 91.3% mark in a single game, marking a turning point in the team’s future.

namedEntities.name: Bo Nix
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: Bo Nix, the second-year quarterback of the Denver Broncos, led a historic fourth-quarter comeback against the New York Giants, becoming the first team in NFL history to overcome a 19-point deficit after leading by 18 points in the first three quarters.

namedEntities.name: Jacoby Brissett
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: Jacoby Brissett, the backup quarterback for the Arizona Cardinals, attempted a final drive that was disrupted by Green Bay’s defense, including a key sack by Micah Parsons.

namedEntities.name: Tua Tagovailoa
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: Tua Tagovailoa was benched during the Miami Dolphins’ game against the Cleveland Browns due to three interceptions, including one returned for a touchdown.

namedEntities.name: Justin Fields
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: Justin Fields, the starting quarterback for the New York Jets, was benched at halftime against the Carolina Panthers due to poor first-half performance and lack of offensive production.

namedEntities.name: Quinn Ewers
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: Quinn Ewers, a seventh-round rookie, replaced Tua Tagovailoa in the fourth quarter of the Miami Dolphins’ game after Tagovailoa’s disastrous performance.

namedEntities.name: Tyrod Taylor
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: Tyrod Taylor replaced Justin Fields in the second half of the Jets’ game against the Panthers and provided better offensive performance, though he still threw two costly interceptions.

namedEntities.name: Micah Parsons
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: Micah Parsons, traded to the Green Bay Packers from the Dallas Cowboys, recorded a third sack on Arizona’s final drive and was a disruptive force throughout the game.

namedEntities.name: Tom Brady
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: Tom Brady set the previous franchise record for completion percentage with the New England Patriots in 2009, which was broken by Drake Maye in Week 7 of the 2025 season.

namedEntities.name: Mike Vrabel
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: Mike Vrabel, the head coach of the New England Patriots, won his first game against the franchise he previously coached in, and his team's success under Drake Maye reflects a broader organizational shift.

namedEntities.name: Mike McDaniel
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: Mike McDaniel, head coach of the Miami Dolphins, faced increasing pressure after a disastrous loss to the Cleveland Browns, which led to the benching of quarterback Tua Tagovailoa.

namedEntities.name: Aaron Glenn
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: Aaron Glenn, the first-year head coach of the New York Jets, made a halftime decision to bench Justin Fields, citing the need for a 'spark' in the team’s offense.

summaryOfNewsArticle: In Week 7 of the 2025 NFL season, dramatic comebacks and record-breaking performances defined the outcomes. The Denver Broncos made history by overcoming a 19-point deficit against the New York Giants, becoming the first team to do so after leading by 18 points in the first three quarters. Second-year QB Bo Nix delivered a standout fourth-quarter performance, throwing two touchdowns and running for scores. In a separate game, the New England Patriots' Drake Maye broke Tom Brady's franchise record with a 91.3% completion rate, completing 21-of-23 passes and rushing for 62 yards. Meanwhile, quarterback struggles led to benchings: Tua Tagovailoa was replaced by rookie Quinn Ewers in Miami, and Justin Fields was benched by the Jets at halftime after a poor first half. The Jets remained winless at 0-7, while the Dolphins fell to 1-13. These events highlight the season's unpredictability, with late-game momentum, quarterback instability, and record-breaking individual performances shaping the narrative.
title: Historic and dramatic comebacks, second-year QB breaks Tom Brady record and high-profile benchings: NFL Week 7 Sunday review
